title: My Learned Friend may be politically incorrect, but it's a comic classic
text:
Will Hay’s act as a disreputable schoolmaster on the wilder shores of charlatanry, beloved by music-hall and wireless audiences, was brilliantly exploited when talking pictures arrived in Britain in the late Twenties, and made him one of the big box office stars of the Thirties and early Forties.

He was no spit-and-sawdust comedy turn. Hay came from a middle-class family and by his late teens had reached interpreter standard in French, Italian and German. He had a passion for astronomy, and in 1933 discovered a Great White Spot on Saturn. But before the Great War, he conceived a desire to become a stand-up, and joined Fred Karno’s Army, the impresario’s troupe of music-hall comedians.
